text.p: Here are the highlights from Swiss newspapers on Thursday: NEUE ZUERCHER ZEITUNG - World Jewish Congress head Edgar Bronfman was named on Wednesday to temporarily take a seat on the special Swiss Humanitarian Fund. TAGES ANZEIGER - The Swiss government said in a statement that it will not take action to stop a German language spelling reform. Swiss right-wing Freiheitspartei demanded that the changes be rejected. - Swiss consumer confidence registered a further boost in the 1997 first quarter as a main index rose to minus 31 points. -- Zurich Editorial +41 1 631 7340
